title: Google's AI Mode can now dig through your Photos and Gmail to give more personalized answers
snippet: Google's AI Mode now includes Personal Intelligence which allows users to get tailored search results by connecting to Gmail and Google Photos. The feature is currently only available to Google's paid subscribers in the US.

title: Is Microsoft 365 still down? What we know as thousands of users report outages
snippet: More than 15,000 outage reports were logged as of 1.34 am IST on 23 January. Microsoft has acknowledged the issue and is working on a fix. Check the latest update here

title: Elon Musk says artificial intelligence may outthink humanity by 2031
snippet: Elon Musk has warned that artificial intelligence could overtake the combined intelligence of humanity within the next decade, saying rapid advances may soon produce machines smarter than any human, while urging stronger oversight even as his companies push AI development forward.

title: Gujarat Dy CM Harsh Sanghavi discusses AI, advanced computing, next-gen digital infra with tech giants at Davos
snippet: Speaking with ANI, Sanghavi said the discussions focused on artificial intelligence, advanced computing, data centers, and next-generation digital infrastructure, with Gujarat positioning itself as a preferred destination for high-tech and future-oriented investments."

title: Motorola Signature to launch in India on 23 January: When, where and how to watch the livestream
snippet: Motorola is launching its new flagship smartphone, the Motorola Signature, in India on 23 January. The premium device features a 165Hz LTPO AMOLED display, Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 chipset, fast charging support and long-term Android updates. Here's how to watch the livestream.

title: Apple’s Siri makeover could close the AI gap with ChatGPT and Gemini: Here's how
snippet: Apple is reportedly planning a major Siri overhaul later this year, turning it into a conversational AI chatbot deeply integrated across iPhone, iPad and Mac, as the company looks to catch up with rivals OpenAI and Google in generative AI.

title: How students can take full-length SAT practice tests inside Google Gemini
snippet: Google has added SAT exam preparation to its Gemini app, allowing students to take full-length practice tests using Princeton Review content and receive instant, personalised feedback, with more competitive exams expected to be supported soon.

title: Elon Musk unveils roadmap for smarter AI feeds on X, pledges relevant ads
snippet: Tech mogul Elon Musk said in a tweet on Thursday that X’s AI-powered recommendation system will improve sharply by mid-2026, with more personalised feeds and relevant ads.&nbsp;

title: Google Pixel 10a tipped to launch in March with AMOLED display: What to expect
snippet: Leaked renders of the Google Pixel 10a suggest a familiar design with a dual rear camera, flat metal frame and hole-punch display. The upcoming budget Pixel is expected to launch on March 5 with a Tensor G4 chip and AMOLED screen.

title: Flipkart Republic Day Sale ends today! Massive price drop on MacBooks on the last day
snippet: We noticed a shocking price drop on MacBooks on the last day of the Flipkart Republic Day Sale! Here are all the deals you can't miss out today.

Amazon plans thousands more corporate job cuts next week, sources say
snippet: Amazon is planning a second round of job cuts next week ‍as part of its broader goal ​of trimming some 30,000 corporate workers. The company in October cut some 14,000 white-collar jobs, about half of the 30,000 target.

title: Giva’s funding glitter; PhonePe cofounders sell big stake
snippet: Happy Friday! Giva is set to close a fresh funding round amid rising D2C jewellery interest. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

title: TikTok reaches deal for new US joint venture to avoid American ban
snippet: The deal is a milestone for the short video app after years ​of battles that ​began in August 2020, when ‌President Donald ‍Trump first tried unsuccessfully ‍to ban the app over national ‌security concerns.

title: China, Hong Kong hold India’s chip supply reins
snippet: China remains India’s top chip supplier, accounting for nearly 30% of integrated circuits and micro assembly shipment worth $5.78 billion in April–November FY26, while Hong Kong contributed 18.5%. US shipments surged, but Taiwan’s supply fell. Overall, India sourced chips from 64 countries, slightly

title: DLI 2.0 may shift from reimbursements to equity-linked support
snippet: The government is redesigning its Design Linked Incentive (DLI) scheme 2.0 for semiconductor companies, shifting from reimbursement-based support to equity- or debt-linked funding with stronger IP oversight. The new scheme may support larger chip design projects and retain strategic intellectual pro

title: Mphasis Q3 profit up 3.5% YoY to Rs 442 crore
snippet: Indian mid-tier IT firms showed mixed performance in Q3 FY26, affected by seasonal softness and labour code changes. Mphasis posted a 3.3% YoY profit rise to Rs 442 crore, while Cyient’s profit fell 25% to Rs 91.8 crore. AI-led deals and BFSI growth helped offset some challenges across the sector.

title: Giva in talks to close Rs 150-200 crore funding at Rs 4,400-crore valuation
snippet: Silver jewellery brand Giva is closing a Rs 150-200 crore funding round led by Premji Invest and Creaegis, with participation from Titan and Kenro Capital. The deal, partly primary and partly secondary, values the company at around Rs 4,200-4,400 crore. Giva is expected to post Rs 800-850 crore reve

title: The AI startup soap opera riveting Silicon Valley
snippet: Thinking Machines, the AI startup cofounded by former OpenAI CTO Mira Murati, has faced internal turmoil as top executives Zoph, Metz and Schoenholz left for OpenAI amid disagreements over strategy and funding. title: WEF 2026: Elon Musk predicts robots will outnumber humans in AI-driven economy
snippet: Elon Musk, at the World Economic Forum, said AI and robotics could drive unprecedented global economic growth, creating a future of abundance where machines meet most human needs. He predicted robots may outnumber humans and help eliminate poverty, while cautioning on associated risks. Musk also dis

title: Rwanda to test AI-powered technology in clinics under a new Gates Foundation project
snippet: Rwanda will test technology powered by artificial intelligence in more than 50 health clinics as part of a new initiative by the Gates Foundation to support 1,000 clinics across Africa with the aim to improve health care services.

title: Rethinking AI’s future in an augmented workplace

title: Everyone wants AI sovereignty. No one can truly have it.
snippet: Governments plan to pour $1.3 trillion into AI infrastructure by 2030 to invest in “sovereign AI,” with the premise being that countries should be in control of their own AI capabilities.
